snippet: When the Titanic went down about 960 miles from New York, the city's newspapers came up with many ways to get the news of the catastrophe to hungry readers.
abstract: When the Titanic went down about 960 miles from New York, the city's newspapers came up with many ways to get the news of the catastrophe to hungry readers.

headline.main: After Ship Sank, Fierce Fight to Get Story
headline.print_headline: After the Ship Sank, a Fierce Fight to Get the Story
